title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Monday 3 April - BBC News
summary: inspectors castigate 'unsafe ' isle of wight nhs trust .
aslef members reject southern rail deal .
motorcyclist killed in crash with car near blandford .

drunk electrician tried to cut down speed camera with saw after 'downing whiskey '

documents.title: isle of wight nhs trust : 'things need to change '
text: `` the country 's top health inspector has recommended that the isle of wight nhs trust is .
placed into so-called special measures .
`` the bbc has seen a draft letter from the chief inspector of hospitals , listing a series of criticisms .
`` it highlights patients at risk , disillusioned staff and inadequate bosses - how much worse could it be ?
`` one hundred and forty thousand people rely on the island 's health service - it 's hard not to think they 've been let down .
`` this is a difficult time for the trust whose leadership has been slated from the board level down .
`` the acting chief executive has apologised and reassured the patients and public that issues are being taken very seriously .
things need to change .
how soon and in what way will become clear when the cqc report is published in full . ''
author: David Fenton
Health Correspondent, BBC South

documents.title: the band musical heads for southampton
text: the new musical based on the music of take that will take in southampton on it 's uk tour .
the band will feature the winning boy band from bbc talent show let it shine .
it will be on stage at the mayflower theatre from 31st october - 11 november .

it follows a group of teenage girls growing up in 1992 as devoted fans of a boyband and revisits them 25 years later when they are 40-something women who try to fulfil their dream of meeting their heroes .
the band will be played by aj bentley , nick carsberg , yazdan qafouri isfahani , curtis t johns and sario watanabe-solomon , who won let it shine as group five to five .

this is all new for us , to be able to sit in an audience and watch our music being performed.to anyone who 's been involved in music at any point in their life , this turns the table and pays respect to those who loved it , supported it , made it part of their lives . ''

documents.title: possible sighting of missing woman
text: an `` easily confused '' woman , who has been missing for more than a week from her home in bournemouth , may have called at an address in ferndown asking for money , police have said .
a member of the public has told police this afternoon that a woman answering jean lea 's description called at her door in mountbatten drive requesting `` sponsorship money '' .
the visitor seemed `` lost '' and did not call at other houses , police added .
ms lea , 67 , left her home address on meadow view road shortly before 03:00 bst on 26 march .

text: bodies mutilated to 'stop dead rising '

documents.title: motorcyclist in fatal crash named
text: a 74-year-old motorcyclist who died in a collision with a car near compton abbas airfield yesterday has been named as sid samways from blandford .
his 71-year-old wife barbara , who was a pillion passenger , is critically ill in hospital .
the car driver , a 24-year-old man from the shaftesbury area , was arrested and bailed until june .
police want to trace witnesses who saw either the black kawasaki motorcycle or the green ford escort being driven before the crash , which happened at about 15:40 bst on higher shaftesbury road .

documents.title: aslef members reject southern rail deal
text: aslef members reject southern rail deal

documents.title: breakingsecond rejection for rail deal
text: a deal aimed at ending the long-running dispute between southern railway and the aslef union over driver-only trains has been narrowly rejected .
it is the second time in a row that union members have rejected a compromise agreed by their own leaders over the issue .
52 % of those voting were against the deal , on a turnout of 75 % .

documents.title: murder accused ' can not remember stabbing ex-girlfriend to death '
text: a soldier slept next to his former partner 's body after stabbing her to death , a court has heard .
jay nava , 27 , from plymouth is on trial for murdering natasha wake , 26 , from bournemouth .

mr nava , who denies the charge , said he could not remember carrying out the attack but admitted he scrubbed the walls , wrapped her body in a duvet and hid her in a cupboard so her two children would not see what had happened .
a psychiatrist for the defence told the jury mr nava was suffering from a personality disorder which `` substantially impaired '' his self-control .
the trial at winchester crown court continues .
author: Emily Ford
BBC South

documents.title: ex-soldier 'filled with remorse ' after killing ex-girlfriend
text: a former soldier has told his trial he was `` filled with remorse and wanted to die '' after stabbing his ex-girlfriend to death .
jay nava is accused of murdering 26-year-old natasha wake , from bournemouth , after stabbing her 11 times in the chest and neck .

the 27-year-old , who was a serving soldier in plymouth at the time of the killing , told winchester crown court he `` just wanted to get the children out '' after killing their mother while they slept upstairs .
afterwards he said he did not see the point in living .
mr nava denies murder .
author: Emily Ford
BBC South

documents.title: patients 'at risk ' at 'inadequate ' nhs trust
text: some patients being cared for by the nhs on the isle of wight are at risk of harm , according to a report by health inspectors .
south has seen the draft findings of a care quality commission inspection , due to be published next week , which recommends that the isle of wight nhs trust be placed in special measures .
the letter says staff reported being `` bullied , overworked and harrassed '' .
the trust 's chief executive karen baker .
resigned last week , .
saying the organisation needed a `` fresh pair of eyes '' .

documents.title: talks planned on troubled academy
text: the councillor in charge of isle of wight schools has requested a meeting with the leaders of the troubled sandown bay academy over its finances .

chris whitehouse has previously criticised the academies enterprise trust ( aet ) for planning to cut £ 850,000 from the secondary school , a figure later reduced to `` less than £ 250,000 '' over two years .
aet said it expected to remove up to 18 staff , including eight teaching posts , mainly as a result of falling pupil numbers at the `` academically weak '' school .
mr whitehouse has said that aet was unfit to govern the academy , which was heading for `` potential financial and educational disaster '' .

documents.title: man held over park stabbing
text: a man has been arrested over a stabbing in southampton .
a 42-year-old man was stabbed in the neck in watts park on thursday afternoon .
hampshire constabulary said an 18-year-old man from london was being held on sus of attempted murder and being concerned with the supply of class a drugs .

documents.title: intruder child sex attack trial : man 'fell asleep on bed '
text: a man broke into a house and sexually assaulted a young girl before falling asleep in her bunk bed , a court has been told .
jervais jones , 25 , is accused of attacking the six-year-old in weymouth in october last year .
prosecutors allege mr jones , of no fixed address , broke into the terraced house in wyke regis in the early hours of the morning .
appearing at bournemouth crown court , mr jones denies sexually assaulting a child and trespassing with intent to commit a sexual offence .

documents.title: 'restless corpses ' mutilated by medieval villagers
text: medieval people mutilated corpses to stop them rising from the grave , the university of southampton and historic england have suggested .

knife-marks and scorching on bones excavated from wharram percy , a deserted medieval village in north yorkshire , are probably signs of attempts to stop the dead menacing the living , researchers said .
some corpses were decapitated and dismembered , a method described by medieval writers as a way of preventing reanimation .
lead researcher dr simon mays from the university of southampton said : `` this is the first good archaeological evidence we have for this dark side of medieval beliefs . ''

documents.title: 'loud tv ' call-out for firefighters
text: firefighters broke into a home in crookham village near fleet last night , after the elderly resident failed to answer the door to their carer .
the crew said the 97-year-old failed to answer the door because of a tv on at `` full volume '' and suddenly found their front room full of firefighters .
last night we were called to gain entry to a property .
one young 97 year old with the tv at full volume got a front room of firefighters
@ twitterid bet she enjoyed that party and i bet she offered everyone a brew lol
lucky lady !
half of our choir would do that for that response i reckon .
i hope the elder was ok .

documents.title: thousands take part in bay run
text: about 3,000 runners helped raise more than £ 20,000 for the british heart foundation on sunday , by competing in the bournemouth bay run .
courses ranged from 1km to a half marathon , with the event celebrating its 35th anniversary .

documents.title: ambulance kit reviewed over weight concerns
text: south east coast ambulance service says it 's reviewing the amount of equipment carried by some of its vehicles , after discovering some of them were close to being over legal weight .
the trust says 18 of its 300 ambulances were found to be affected when tests were carried out with full kit and a patient on board .
author: Bob Dale
BBC Live reporter

documents.title: east cliff lift to close 'for at least two years '
text: a lift and toilets , damaged by a. cliff collapse in april 2016 , . are set to remain out of action for at least a further two years , bournemouth council has said .
contractors have removed 140 tonnes of rubble from the east cliff and have protected the site with matting .
over the next two weeks , climbers will inspect the cliff and establish the scale of repairs needed .
bournemouth council 's director of environment , larry austin , said : `` the costs are likely to be significant . ''

documents.title: 'dogfish ' encounter on weymouth beach
text: a stranded spurdog , or spiny dogfish , was an object of fascination on weymouth beach yesterday .
victoria crawford , who photographed the encounter , said : `` seems like the vulnerable small grey shark became stranded after it was spotted swimming in shallow waters on saturday . ''
genevieve lily , victoria 's two-year-old bichon frise , gave the creature the customary canine inspection .

documents.title: sport : arter rues penalty slip-up
text: bournemouth 's harry arter said his .
missed penalty .
in saturday 's goalless draw at southampton was `` disappointing '' but `` part and parcel of football '' .
arter 's standing leg slipped as he blazed over 13 minutes from time .
the result leaves both sides mid-table on 34 points , although saints have two games in hand on their south coast rivals .
portsmouth boosted their league two promotion chances with a 2-0 win at hartlepool , but striker noel hunt could miss the rest of the season through injury .
non-league eastleigh lost 4-0 at high-flying dagenham and redbridge .

documents.title: missing explosive shells mystery solved
text: two unexploded shells found on a beach which later disappeared have been located .
the two explosives were found at hurst spit near milford-on-sea shortly before 21:30 bst on thursday night by a member of the public .
the shells then vanished overnight from inside a police cordon before bomb disposal experts arrived .
police said a member of the public who had put the shells back in the sea in an area not regularly used by bathers had since come forward .

documents.title: motorcyclist killed near blandford
text: a 74-year-old man died when his motorcycle was in collision with a car near blandford yesterday , police have said .
the man 's pillion passenger , a 71-year-old woman , also from the blandford area , was airlifted to hospital with life-threatening injuries .
the ford escort driver , a 24-year-old man from the shaftesbury area , was arrested .
police have appealed for information about the crash which happened at about 15:40 bst on the higher shaftesbury road near compton abbas airfield .
